void cvl_tonemap_reinhard02 (cvl_frame_t *dst, cvl_frame_t *src, cvl_frame_t *tmp, float log_avg_lum, float brightness, float white, float sharpness, float threshold)

Detailed Description

Handling High Dynamic Range (HDR) frames.
All tone mapping operators (TMOs) take normalized CVL_XYZ frames as input. If you have CVL_XYZ frames with absolute values, you need to convert them with cvl_luminance_range() first. TMOs that work on absolute luminance values have an additional parameter called max_abs_lum. If the maximum absolute luminance is known, this parameter can be set accordingly. If the maximum absolute luminance is not known, the parameter can be used to prescale the values to a suitable range.

Function Documentation

float cvl_log_avg_lum ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
cvl_frame_t *  tmp,
float  max_abs_lum 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
tmp A frame for temporary results.
max_abs_lum Maximum absolute luminance.
Returns:
The log average luminance.
Computes the log average luminance of the given frame, with respect to the given maximum absolute luminance.
The frame tmp must have and least one channel and the type CVL_FLOAT.

void cvl_tonemap_schlick94 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  p 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
p Parameter.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The parameter p must be greater than or equal to 1.0.
See also section 7.2.9 in E. Reinhard and G. Ward and S. Pattanaik and P. Debevec, High Dynamic Range Imaging: Acquisition, Display and Image-based Lighting, Morgan Kaufmann, 2005, ISBN 0-12-585263-0

void cvl_tonemap_tumblin99 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  max_abs_lum,
float  log_avg_lum,
float  display_adaptation_level,
float  max_displayable_contrast 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
max_abs_lum Maximum absolute luminance.
log_avg_lum The log-average luminance.
display_adaptation_level Display adaptation level.
max_displayable_contrast Maximum displayable contrast.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The log_avg_lum parameter must be the log average luminance of src scaled to max_abs_lum. See cvl_log_avg_lum(). The display_adaptation_level parameter must be greater than zero. The max_displayable_contrast parameter must be greater than zero.
See also section 7.2.2 in E. Reinhard and G. Ward and S. Pattanaik and P. Debevec, High Dynamic Range Imaging: Acquisition, Display and Image-based Lighting, Morgan Kaufmann, 2005, ISBN 0-12-585263-0

void cvl_tonemap_drago03 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  max_abs_lum,
float  bias,
float  max_disp_lum 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
max_abs_lum Maximum absolute luminance.
bias Bias.
max_disp_lum Maximum display luminance.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The bias parameter must be from [0,1]. The max_disp_lum parameter must be greater than zero.
See also: F. Drago, K. Myszkowski, T. Annen and N. Chiba, Adaptive Logarithmic Mapping For Displaying High Contrast Scenes. Proc. Eurographics 2003.

void cvl_tonemap_reinhard05 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  min_lum,
float  avg_lum,
float  log_avg_lum,
cvl_frame_t *  rgb,
const float  channel_avg[3],
float  f,
float  c,
float  l 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
min_lum Minimum luminance value in src.
avg_lum Average luminance value in src.
log_avg_lum Log average luminance value in src.
rgb A RGB version of src.
channel_avg Average channel values in rgb.
f Brightness parameter.
c Chromatic adaptation parameter.
l Light adaptation parameter.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
This function needs some information that needs to be computed from the source frame src: min_lum, avg_lum, log_avg_lum, a CVL_RGB version of src, and the average RGB channel values.
The f parameter must be from [-8,8] (default: 0). The c parameter must be from [0,1] (default: 0). The l parameter must be from [0,1] (default: 1). * The max_disp_lum parameter must be greater than zero.
See also: E. Reinhard and K. Devlin. Dynamic range reduction inspired by photoreceptor physiology. Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics, Volume 11, Issue 1, Jan.-Feb. 2005, pp 13-24.

void cvl_tonemap_ashikhmin02 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  min_abs_lum,
float  max_abs_lum,
cvl_frame_t *  tmp,
float  threshold 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
min_abs_lum Minimum absolute luminance.
max_abs_lum Maximum absolute luminance.
tmp A frame for temporary results.
threshold Threshold parameter.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The temporary frame tmp must have four channels of type CVL_FLOAT. The threshold parameter must be from [0,10].
See also: M. Ashikhmin. A tone mapping algorithm for high contrast images. EGRW 2002: Proceedings of the 13th Eurographics workshop on Rendering, pp. 145-156.

void cvl_tonemap_durand02 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  max_abs_lum,
cvl_frame_t *  tmp,
int  k,
float  sigma_spatial,
float  sigma_luminance,
float  base_contrast 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
max_abs_lum Maximum absolute luminance.
tmp A frame for temporary results.
k Mask size 2*k+1 x 2*k+1.
sigma_spatial Spatial sigma.
sigma_luminance Luminance sigma.
base_contrast Base contrast.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The temporary frame tmp must have four channels of type CVL_FLOAT. The sigma values must be greater than zero, and the base_contrast parameter must be grater than 1.
See also: F. Durand and J. Dorsey, Fast Bilateral Filtering for the Display of High-Dynamic-Range Images, Proc. ACM SIGGRAPH 2002, pp. 257-266.

void cvl_tonemap_reinhard02 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
cvl_frame_t *  tmp,
float  log_avg_lum,
float  brightness,
float  white,
float  sharpness,
float  threshold 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
tmp A frame for temporary results.
log_avg_lum The log-average luminance of src.
brightness Brightness parameter.
white Lowest value that will be mapped to white.
sharpness Sharpness parameter.
threshold Threshold parameter.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The temporary frame tmp must have four channels of type CVL_FLOAT. The log_avg_lum parameter must be the log-average luminance of src (unscaled). The brightness parameter must be from [0,1]. The white parameter must be from [0,100). The sharpness parameter must be from [0,100). The threshold parameter must be from [0,1].
See also: E. Reinhard and M. Stark and P. Shirley and J. Ferwerda. Photographic Tone Reproduction for Digital Images. Proc. ACM SIGGRAPH 2002, pp. 267-276.
